text: <@U13TWBRBL>  <@U1C3LNJ58>  - do we still need any of these?  Especially the v0.6 ones?    <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/q/owner:eabailey%2540us.ibm.com+status:open>
<@U0PB67X4K> I don’t believe we need any of them, Allen’s 1655 contains a consolidated set for all needed in 0.6
will confirm with Allen once he comes in
in a few min i believe
<@U0KQ9QKH6> and others, daily scrums starting now: <https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/bqyxlr6u25epjpn4iayws5kksue>
<@U0PB67X4K> those in your list above will be abandoned
Thx <@U13TWBRBL>

<@U11HH3P7Y> in this morning’s scrums, we talked about enabling CI on the new project (which you and I discussed briefly on Friday), but I think we should start by disabling the CI on master for all node-sdk related tests. they are testing old, inconsistent code and will pretty much be guaranteed to fail. can you look into that the sooner the better?
<@U11HH3P7Y|ramesh> has joined the channel
hi <@U11HH3P7Y> see above, thanks
hi <@U13TWBRBL> I have submitted patch set for new jenkins job for fabric-sdk-node repository.. Reference here <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1807/>
<@U13TWBRBL>  - agree with you on that.   we should not have any SDK requests against fabric master.  The only thing we should have in the future will be against the v0.6 branch if we have any issues
also - are we planning to push a new hfc v0.6.x release this week?
right now we don't have CI job for master branch..
<@U11HH3P7Y> cool, then that’s settled :wink:
the existing job we have is to test v0.6 branch and in addition I have created a new job for fabric-sdk-node repository.
<@U0PB67X4K> <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-641>
cool
status = will move from .6 to the new project

<@U0PB67X4K> <@U13TWBRBL> please approve and merge:
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1815/1>
I just published the new hfc package version 0.6.3. Closing FAB-641.
Will do when I get free.  Stuck in line trying to park at the airport
CI still running
k
I verified and +2.  Need one more to merge
ok thanks for update

<@U11HH3P7Y> it looks like the "/fabric-sdk-node-verify-x86_64” CI job is being triggered by commits to fabric-sdk-node. is that by mistake? we need a new job that simply does “npm install”, “gulp" and “node test/unit/headless-tests.js” for now. later on once we enhance the test scripts to build a docker-based target, we might consider having the CI job build the latest images from fabric
i see the build takes only 4min to finish, that’s good news. but it should be even faster if we skip the part concerning the fabric project content
it's  not by mistake.. As mentioned earlier created a new job for sdk-node repository.. Right now, I am just executing npm install and executing headless-tests.js
sure will add once test scripts are ready.
ok i see, i think it’s the workspace’s working directory (gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric) that confused me. guess it's a holdover from a previous template?
oh ok.. yes work directory I have used the same. next time when I push changes to this job will modify this..
can you please give me the gulp command?
it’s simply “gulp"
oh ok
runs the default task which is eslint
you’d need to install gulp as a global module in order to get the command
ok will check and ping you if need any help
<@U1KFBBWG1> have you got a JIRA task opened for the hierarchical configuration work you are doing?
observed permission denied error messages while installing gulp in global.. Will check this tomorrow
good night
